Posted By: Neutralion (12/26/2009 3:32:59 AM)

posts.post_content:
@Wanderer25: I think it'd be more fun to run this in a [Damia, Sage of Stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damia, Sage of Stone) deck. It should always be a 7/7 when attacking, because you can hold your spells off until next turn. Then you can play semi-group hug with cards like [Rites of Flourishing](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rites of Flourishing) and similar draw effects. With [Anvil of Bogardan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Anvil of Bogardan), this and [Multani, Maro-Sorcerer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Multani, Maro-Sorcerer) will be having Timmy grinning from ear to ear.  
  
@Sironos: Why waste a card on [Spellbook](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spellbook) when you can run [Reliquary Tower](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Reliquary Tower)? Financially, the tower is more expensive, but not out of most player's budgets, and it's sure worth having a card that does more than just sit there when you have 7 or less cards.
posts.html:
@Wanderer25: I think it'd be more fun to run this in a Damia, Sage of Stone deck. It should always be a 7/7 when attacking, because you can hold your spells off until next turn. Then you can play semi-group hug with cards like Rites of Flourishing and similar draw effects. With Anvil of Bogardan, this and Multani, Maro-Sorcerer will be having Timmy grinning from ear to ear.

@Sironos: Why waste a card on Spellbook when you can run Reliquary Tower? Financially, the tower is more expensive, but not out of most player's budgets, and it's sure worth having a card that does more than just sit there when you have 7 or less cards.

Posted By: sarroth (12/8/2011 9:36:43 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A few quick tips:  
- [Gush](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gush) gives +4/+4 for no mana cost  
- [Meloku, the Clouded Mirror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Meloku, the Clouded Mirror) lets you sweep your untapped land for +1/+1 and a token per land. (Sweep keyword spells aren't on-colour for some reason =/)  
- [Sturmgeist](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sturmgeist) is Overbeings 5 through 8 if they connect. For that matter, stacking these guys is always fun.  
  
In general, a card that returns things to your hand as a cost tends to be good. [Scryb Ranger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scryb Ranger) is a nice partner once you've got enough land drops, giving you pseudo-vigilance and keeping the Overbeing nice and large, with the option to return a forest on your opponent's turn as well if need be.
posts.html:
A few quick tips:
- Gush gives +4/+4 for no mana cost
- Meloku, the Clouded Mirror lets you sweep your untapped land for +1/+1 and a token per land. (Sweep keyword spells aren't on-colour for some reason =/)
- Sturmgeist is Overbeings 5 through 8 if they connect. For that matter, stacking these guys is always fun.

In general, a card that returns things to your hand as a cost tends to be good. Scryb Ranger is a nice partner once you've got enough land drops, giving you pseudo-vigilance and keeping the Overbeing nice and large, with the option to return a forest on your opponent's turn as well if need be.
